steps.text: Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner to remove mold release materials.
Sand old or new gelcoat with DA sander and grade 80+ abrasive discs to remove imperfections.
Apply dry guide coat, re-sand, clean the repair area.
Mix and apply Marine Blister Repair Filler, sand, and repeat with Dry Guide Coat.
Apply Marine Premium Filler in tight coat, sand with grade 120+ abrasive discs.
Finish by sanding repair area with grade 220+ abrasive discs.
Ensure surface is dry and mask areas with 3M™ Precision Masking Tape, then back it up.
Apply gelcoat using a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun and adjust settings.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Sand refinement using 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ and then 400+ grade abrasives.
Refine sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and a Rotary Polishing machine.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a wool compounding pad.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
If surface is in good condition, start sanding with P800 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
For gelcoat finishing process, refer to page 3 & 4.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 80+ grade abrasive discs.
Apply 3M Marine Premium Filler and follow the instructions for application and sanding.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix primer in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Sand the primer using dry guide coat and 320+ grade abrasive discs, then repeat with 400+ grade.
Mix marine paint in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun.
Clean the surface.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M Hookit Purple Finishing Film Disc 260L+ P1200/1500 grade or Trizact Hookit Clear Coat Sanding Disc grade 1500 with a soft interface pad.
Refine scratches using 3M Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 or Trizact Hookit Foam.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 220+ grade abrasive.
Mix and apply 3M Marine Premium Filler.
Sand the filled area with 120+ grade abrasive, then finish with 220+ grade.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix bottom paint using a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M Performance Spray Gun.
Ensure the surface is dry before painting.
Consult a safety professional or visit www.3M.com for regulations.
Provide contact information for 3M United Kingdom plc and 3M Ireland Limited.

constraints.text: The customer is solely responsible for evaluating the product and following all applicable regulations.
Products are intended for trained industrial and occupational customers only, not for consumer use.
